text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a very special guest, Max
Schneider!
Max: Hey what’s up baby, how we doing?

Ro: I am so excited because we have never
baked before. Max: Yeah we never have.

Ro: And he’s pretty cool! He’s got an
awesome music channel, I’ll put a link down below

Ro: so you can go check it out. And what’s
new with you? What do you got going on?

Max: I don’t know, just happy, living life,
but uh, I got a, I got a couple projects,

Max: I just put out my new single Gibberish
featuring Hoodie Allen.

Ro: I love that one! Max: Uh, which was really
exciting, we put out a few weeks ago.

Ro: And it goes in reverse. Max: It goes in
reverse. Ro: The whole music video. So cool!

Max: Yeah, yeah, the whole music video is
a forward-reverse 1 take video and I was really

Max: excited, it got 4 million views in the
first week which was, which was really

Max: wonderful, so thank you anybody who watched.
And uh, the second project is with

Max: Tim Armstrong for the band Rancid, we
have a side project called Wichita, which

Max: is old school soul music. And then the
third thing is I have a new movie come,

Max: coming out June 5th, it’s called Love
and Mercy, it’s about the Beach Boys and

Max: Brian Wilson’s life, it’s his Biopic,
and uh, yeah, I’m really excited about that.

Max: It’s got a great cast, John Cusack,
Paul Giamatti, Elizabeth Banks and Paul Dano.

Ro: Oh, so exciting! Max: And I get to play
Van Dyke Parks who was one of the producers

Max: for the Smile record, and uh, yeah, so
I’m really excited about that too.

Ro: That’s awesome! OK, I will put links
down below to any of those projects that I

Ro: have links to! Max: Oh, yeah, awesome.
Ro: So if you guys want to check ‘em out,
Ro: check them out!

Ro: And, most of you guys know that I am a
huge Walking Dead fan, and when season 5,

Ro: episode 13 came out, I got so many requests
from you guys to make something

Ro: Carol’s Cookies! And AMC released the
official Carol’s Cookies recipe.

Ro: So today, we are gonna be making it and
trying it out for you guys! Alright ready?
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: B-b-b-b-but before we get started… Max:
Mmmhmm. Ro: I’m kind of dressed like Carol,

Max: Yeah. Ro: I got my sweater, you know,
on. So I got an outfit for you.

Max: You got an outfit for me? Ro: Yeah, you’re
gonna be Rick! Max: Oh!

Ro: You’re gonna like this. Max: Here we
go! Ro: It’s good, it’s good, it’s good!

Ro: OK, OK, OK. Max: Oh yes, oh yes! Ro: Check
this out, put this guy on.

Max: Super on my head! Fit’s like a charm.
Ro: Adjust that, and, and I have a shirt, I have a shirt.

Ro: Let me find it! Max: Oh there’s a shirt,
there’s a shirt too!

Max: I was really hoping. Ro: Here you are
Mr… Mr. Rick Grimes.

Max: I didn’t know if I should come in costume…
Ah, yes! Ro: There we go!

Ro: Mr. Grimes over here, Carol and Rick.
Hanging out! Max: Oh you know it!
Ro: Baking it! Oh yeah, oh yeah, oh yeah. Max: Oh yeah!

Ro: Rick and Carol, ready to bake. Max: Howdy,
howdy.

Ro: the things you’ll need, will be: 1 cup
of regular flour, 1/4 cup of apple sauce,

Ro: 1/4 cup of regular granulated sugar, 1/4
cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup shortening,

Ro: 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1/8 teaspoon
of salt, that is so small I didn’t

Ro: have that measurement, so just put in
a pinch of salt.

Ro: 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda, and 1/4 teaspoon
of baking powder.

Max: You’ll also need, 1 delicious chocolate
bar, it doesn’t matter which kind, but

Max: use the good stuff, 1 mixing bowl, 1
hand mixer, and 1 cookie sheet.

Ro: Boom! Now let’s put it all together!
Max: Wooo!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is we’re gonna mix together in a big mixing bowl,

Ro: our brown sugar, light sugar, applesauce
and shortening. Max: Mmmhmmm.

Ro: And I’m gonna have you mix. Max: Oh
I’m gonna mix, OK let’s mix!

Ro: You’re gonna be in charge of this guy,
he’s pretty fun! Max: Oh-hoo-hoo!

Ro: OK, so first I’m gonna add my sugars,
there we go! Then our applesauce. Max: Mmmhmmm.
Ro: Our shortening! Max: Mmm!

Ro: And, this recipe is super simple, it uses
all simple ingredients because it was
Ro: a recipe that you could make in the apocalypse.

Max: Yeah, you know, so, heaven forbid…
Ro: Yeah. Max: We’re ready to go!
Ro: Alright, mix it up! Max: Woo-hoo-hoo!

Ro: Alright, next we are gonna add our flour.
Max: Mmmm!

Ro: Here, I’ll have you dump him in there.
Max: Oh, I, oh the honor.
Ro: Little bit of vanilla extract. Max: Mmmhmm.
Ro: A pinch of salt. I’m gonna have you do a pinch because I have really small fingers, so…

Max: Bam! Ro: That pry an accurate pinch.
Max: Spice it up a little!

Ro: And then, baking soda and baking powder.
We’ll each add 1 ready?
Both: 1, 2, 3! Ro: Boom! Max: Yes!

Ro: Grab that mixer Max let’s get it going!
Max: Oh I’m ready to go! Woo! Ro: Get it goin!

Max: So now we have finished our mix, we’re
gonna let it sit for 5 minutes. Ro: Mmmhmm!

Max: And then, we’re gonna heat up our chocolate
in the meanwhile.

Ro: Yeah, yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum! Max: Gonna
be all delicious! Num-num-num-num-num!
Ro: My favorite part!

Ro: Now that we’ve set our mixture to the
side, we’re gonna melt our chocolate and

Ro: remember, this is an apocalypse rationed
recipe, so I want to use the whole

Ro: bar, but the recipe calls for only 1/4
of it. We can only use a quarter of this
Ro: bar, oh this is killing me! Max: Mmmhmmm.

Ro: So Max, can you open that up? Max: Let’s
do it baby! Woo! Oh yeah!
Ro: This is so sad! This is not a lot of chocolate.

Ro: Look at this! OK, so on a Hershey bar, definitely,
do you want to break off 3?
Max: Yeah, just break off these 3?

Ro: 3 little bars will be a fourth. Max: Boom!
Ro: Alright, we’re gonna put it in a

Ro: bowl and melt it. And let me just check,
is this OK? Max: Oh, oh yeah, is this OK?
Max: Or, you know. Ro: We should probably…
Max: I know it's apocalypse, but, we should probably just check and make sure it’s good.

Ro: We should probably just check and make
sure it’s OK!
Ro: Mmmhmm, mmmhmm. Max: Yeah, that’s good!

Ro: It’s like a ration recipe, you don’t
want to. Max: That’s good.

Ro: Now you’re gonna go heat up the chocolate.
Max: Yeah.

Ro: I’m gonna use the microwave for a few
seconds, but you can use a double boiler,

Ro: or if you were in a zombie apocalypse,
you’d probably use a fire.

Max: Just melted the chocolate and now we’re
gonna add it into the recipe, let’s go!

Ro: Look how little amount that chocolate
is, it’s just kind of making me sad.

Max: It’s kind of sad. Ro: It’s so rationed,
not enough chocolate!

Max: Yeah, makes you appreciate the chocolate
we have!

Ro: Now we’re gonna mix 1 more time, and
then we are gonna pop this in the refrigerator,

Ro: for about 5 minutes, because it will be
a little bit easier to work with.
Ro: But, if you’re in the apocalypse, uh, just, you’ll have to work with it sticky.

Max: Yeah, camping, you don’t have a mini
fridge, we understand. Ro: No, yeah.

Max: Should we do this? Ro: Yeah, let’s
mix it up! Max: WOOOOO!!
Ro: Mix it up, mix, mix it up!

Max: Alright, our dough’s done chilling,
what do we do next?

Ro: Next we are gonna roll our little dough
balls, and I’ve got a tablespoon as a

Ro: reference, but it says in the recipe you
want to do a heavy helping. Max: Mmmm.

Ro: Tablespoon, and it should be
about the size of a golf ball.

Ro: So I actually dug, out of our garage,
a golf ball. Max: Awesome.

Ro: So they’ve got to be about this size.
Good reference, I’m gonna keep him right here.

Max: Fantastic, don’t eat it. Ro: Alright,
so, I’ll show you how to do this. Max: Yes!

Ro: That’s good, and then I give that to
you.

Max: That’s good, and then I take it, and
make it into a little ball?
Ro: Yeah, take it out of there, OK, and then roll it. Max: OK, awesome.

Ro: And I’ll roll this 1, just roll, roll,
roll, roll, roll!

Max: Awesome, wash your hands, of course.
Ro: Yeah, yeah!

Max: Gotta make sure that stuff’s good.
Ro: And then, boom!

Ro: Now you’re gonna do this and fill the
rest of your sheet. They need about 2 inches
Ro: in between each cookie.

Ro: Now these cookies are ready to bake, you’re
gonna preheat your oven to 350 degrees

Ro: and bake between 11 to 13 minutes. And
while these are baking, I was wondering,

Ro: do you want to play, it’s 1 of my favorite
retro zombie games,

Ro: it’s House of the Dead 3? Max: I’m
in, let’s do it baby! Woo-woo!
Ro: Oh my gosh! I love this game!

Ro: Oh my gosh, am I the girl? Please, please,
please!
Max: New sheriff in town.

Ro: Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh! Oh no, oh no,
no, no, no, no!

Ro: Uh oh! Max: Oh oh, we got a boss here!
Ro: Uh oh, he looks like a police officer!

Ro: Police officer vs. Sheriff! Max: Oh I’ll
get him! It’s, it’s on!

Ro: His weak point is his head. Max: OK. Ro:
OK, so just go for the head, go for the head!

Ro: Oh my gosh, oh my gosh, oh my gosh! Oh! No,
no, no, no, no!
Ro: We got him! We got him!
Max: Yes! Yaaas! Yaaaas! Ro: Boss down!
Both: Woo!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are The Walking Dead Carol’s Cookies
that we made today! I think we should

Ro: test them, we’ve definitely earned it,
because we worked up a sweat.
Max: Fwew! Ro: Fighting off those zombies!

Ro: Alright, are you ready? Max: Let’s do
it! I’m ready!

Ro: OK, I’m gonna. Max: OK, break it in
half? Ro: These are nice and warm!
Ro: Ready? Max: Ah, 1, 2, 3!
Ro: Mmm! Max: Mmm!

Ro: For an apocalypse cookie, it’s simple.
Max: Mmmhmm.

Ro: But good. Max: Yeah. Ro: And remember,
this recipe has no eggs in it, because

Ro: Carol, didn’t have eggs in the apocalypse,
so she uses the applesauce instead.

Max: There you go. Ro: I’ve never had a
cookie without eggs and applesauce.

Max: Mmmhmm. Ro: This is a first. Max: It’s
nice though.

Ro: I give it a thumbs up! Especially for
the apocalypse. Max: Mmmhmmm.

Ro: These were so much fun to make! Thanks
you guys for suggesting these, and,

Ro: a big thank you to Max for helping me bake
today!
Max: Thanks for having me, this was wonderful!

Ro: This was so fun, you did a great job!
Max: And I learned from the master of course!

Ro: He’s a great helper! And, I’ll be
putting all of Max’s links down below,

Ro: for all of his social medias and all of
the projects that you have going on and

Ro: coming up and all that. Max: Oh thank
you, I hope you guys like it.

Ro: Oh cool! Max: Oooh! Ro: And, if you guys
have any other ideas for any other

Ro: Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave
me a comment down below and I will do my

Ro: best to make it happen! And, I will be
posting lots of pictures of the cookies

Ro: we made today, and if you guys make Carol’s
Cookies, take pictures

Ro: send them to me, I love to re-blog them
and re-post them. And use the

Ro: hashtag #CarolsCookies so that I can find
them. So that we can see them.
Max: Yeah, so we can see ‘em.

Ro: Tweet them to both of us! Max: Tweet them
to both of us!

Max: Wear a big hat! Like this! Ro: Yeah,
wear a big hat. Max: Wear the hat!
Max: It’s a good time!

Ro: Alright, thanks again you guys. Max: Bye
Guys!
Ro: Bye-bye! Max: Thank you!
